results.title: Knuckle Busters  for Commodore 64 & 128
results.material_description: Cassette tape computer game. Cassette, cover and packing foam in a plastic cassette case.
results.brief_description: Knuckle Busters [computer game]. Knuckle Busters is a single player side scrolling action platformer. Players take on the role of Deke, a criminal escaping from a prision facility. Due to Deke’s tampering with the Central Computer, the facility and the city are expected to blow up, thus putting a time limit on the players. Players can jump and drop from platforms, avoid or fight androids, collect items and health from barrels and open doors. Deke’s condition is displayed to the player on a pop up menu including lives left, score, time count down, energy level and current object carried.

results.title: Fist II - The Legend Continues  for Commodore 64 & 128
results.material_description: Cassette tape computer game. Cassette and cover in a plastic cassette case.
results.brief_description: Fist II - The Legend Continues [computer game]. Fist II is a single player side scrolling beat ‘em up with adventure elements. Players travel through different environments, fighting various enemies, collecting items and visiting temples to power up the character to be strong enough to defeat the warlord and free the land.

results.title: Hungry Horace  for Commodore 64
results.material_description: Cassette tape computer game. Cassette and cover in a plastic cassette case.
results.brief_description: Hungry Horace [computer game]. Hungry Horace is a top down single player arcade game similar to Pac Man. Players control Horace through a maze collecting flowers and guards lunches while avoiding capture by the park guards. Horace can ring alarms and frighten guards from the park. If Horace is caught three times, he is thrown out of the park and the game ends.

results.title: Horace Goes Skiing  for Commodore 64
results.creator_credit: William Tang, Melbourne House and Beam Software
results.material_description: Cassette tape computer game. Cassette and cover in a plastic cassette case.
results.brief_description: Horace Goes Skiing [computer game]. Horace Goes Skiing is a single player game with multiple genres. The first is similar to Frogger, where players begin with $40 and guide Horace across a busy road to the ski lodge. Getting hit by a vehicle costs Horace $10 in ambulance fees. Once Horace makes it to the lodge and hires skiis, it becomes a ski game where players slalom between flags and avoid trees. Colliding with a tree will send Horace back to the start of the game. When Horace runs out of money, the game ends.

results.title: The Tolkien Trilogy  for Commodore 64
results.material_description: Cassette tape computer game. Two cassettes, paper manual, plastic cassette tray in a cardboard case
results.brief_description: Contains three games: ‘The Hobbit’, ‘Lord of the Rings’ and ‘Shadows of Mordor’. The games are loosely based on “The Hobbit” and “The Lord of the Rings” novels by J.R.R Tolkien
results.description: Contains three games: ‘The Hobbit’, ‘Lord of the Rings’ and ‘Shadows of Mordor’. The games are loosely based on “The Hobbit” and “The Lord of the Rings” novels by J.R.R Tolkien

results.title: Apple iPhone 3
results.brief_description: Smartphones like the Apple iPhone allow instantaneous recording and sharing of videos. Along with social media, they’ve helped establish and spread social and political movements, while filmmakers have also shot entire films on the portable devices.
results.description: The power to record, document, and film footage is now in everyone’s pocket. Mobile camera phones like those found in the Apple iPhone allow users to capture the world around them and share videos instantly. Along with the advent of social media platforms like Facebook, Twitter and Instagram, the camera phone was an important development in digital connectivity and the spread of social movements like the Arab Spring, Occupy Wall Street and Black Lives Matter. It has also become a modern tool for moviemaking, with filmmakers like Steven Soderbergh, Sean Baker, Jay Alvarez, Park Chan-wook and Michel Gondry shooting whole feature films with mobile cameras.
description_for_label: The power to record, document, and film footage is now in everyone’s pocket. results.title: The Legendary Rex
results.creator_credit: Astrid Scott, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description:
The Rex Theatre, in Charlton, was built in 1938 and opened with the film ‘Mary, Queen of Scots’. David Pollard, who worked as a projectionist at the theatre since 1980, takes us on a tour of this historic theatre. He is the Chairperson of the Charlton Community Theatre and has been working towards getting The Rex into community ownership, as there is not a large population base for the theatre to be commercially viable.
The community has offered voluntary labour and raised over $80,000 and with the help of fundraising from the federal government, it is hoped the theatre will eventually be completely in the hands of the community.

results.title: Lockington Film Premiere: ACMI in the Regions
results.brief_description: In July 2008, the ACMI Content Development crew spent four days in Lockington and produced five short documentary films. The premier screening of these short films took place on the 15th of January 2009, on a hot and humid Thursday evening in the Lockington & District Community Centre. Over 200 locals joined Tony Sweeney and Kim Montgomery, from ACMI, and Louise Ross, a local and chief community organiser, to showcase the films and celebrate the stories that make Lockington a thriving and unique regional town. This film of the premiere screenings captures the excitement of the locals with a red carpet arrival for all the guests, the handing out of DVDs to all individuals that were involved in the project and finally vox pops from the audience members as they share with us their appreciation and pride for the films.

results.title: ACMI in the Regions: Remembering Culgoa Primary School
results.brief_description: The Culgoa Primary School closed its doors for the last time in December 2008, after over 100 years of service, due to the low student intake for the coming year. This film captures moments from a reunion organised to bring together students and teachers in celebration of times past. The town and its people are evidence of the strength and fragility of modern day living in small rural towns. The real, everyday struggles that farmers face and the heartbreaking decisions that families make, whether to stay and “tough it out” or move to a larger satellite town.

results.title: The Birchip Cropping Group
results.creator_credit: Dean Lawry, David Meagher, Jason White, Astrid Scott and ACMI Content Development
results.brief_description: A background history of the Birchip Cropping Group, an agricultural research and extension organisation covering the Wimmera Mallee region set up to assist farmers in crop production. Its philosophy is to produce food that is clean, safe and green. Presented by Alexandra, Fiona, James, Simon and the BCG.
